programme.title: Britain's Secret Charity Cheats
programme.desc: Kevin Duala meets the former paratrooper taking on the bogus military charities collecting on our streets and finds out what benefits charity fundraising balls can bring(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander, Martin Roberts and Dion Dublin meet the new owners of properties in Leybourne in Kent, Newport, south Wales, and Stoke-on-Trent in the Midlands(n)

programme.title: Crimewatch Roadshow
programme.desc: Crimewatch Roadshow Live A year on from the terrorist attacks at Borough Market and London Bridge, Michelle Ackerley finds out how police officers in the city are tackling the ongoing threat of terrorism(n)

programme.title: Close Calls: On Camera
programme.desc: A rescue worker comes to the aid of a crashed mountain biker, and a woman misreads road crossing signs and steps out in front of a biker(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Ardingly 19 Experts Charlie Ross and Charles Hanson lead two enthusiastic pairs of contestants at Ardingly Antiques Fair in West Sussex, where presenter Tim Wonnacott encounters a rather moving picture frame(n)

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Know When to Fold Emma gets tangled up in an argument between Daniel and Zara, while Al becomes involved in a dispute between a father and his daughter(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Althorp 28 Paul Martin, Will Axon and Charles Hanson are at Althorp in Northamptonshire, where items include advertising memorabilia that had been buried and a 19th-century silver sewing kit(n)

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Bourne Charlie Dimmock and Harry and David Rich visit a sparse garden in the town of Bourne, Lincolnshire, whose owners Lizzie and Mike want the colours and feel of an island getaway(n)

programme.title: Hardball
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Ore Oduba in which contestants have to answer questions to get as far along a track as they can before a ball catches and passes them, ending their go(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: 06/06/2018 Matt Baker and Alex Jones host the magazine show, with stories of interest from around the UK, plus celebrity guests in the studio(n)

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are
programme.desc: Michelle Keegan New series. The genealogy documentary follows eight more celebrities as they trace their family trees to uncover facts about their heritage. First up is Our Girl actress Michelle Keegan, who discovers the dark story of how her great-grandmother Leonor, who lived on Gibraltar, was evacuated during the Second World War. She then goes further back to her great-great-grandmother, who lived in poverty in Manchester at the start of the 20th century. But as Michelle investigates, she unearths a special connection to the suffragette movement(n)

programme.title: The Richard Dimbleby Lecture
programme.desc: Award-winning writer and acclaimed author of the semi-autobiographical novel Oranges Are Not the Only Fruit Jeanette Winterson delivers this year's annual lecture, coming for the first time from the Robing Room in the House of Lords at the Palace of Westminster. One hundred years on from the first women in the UK securing the right to vote, Jeanette asks what we can learn from the suffragette movement of a century ago, and examines the potential longevity of recent global campaigns promoting the equality of women. Introduced by David Dimbleby(n)

programme.title: Ambulance
programme.desc: The last Saturday before Christmas is a busy night for the West Midlands Ambulance Service as controller Suki has to prioritise stabbing victims and reports of drowning over patients like Betty, whose daughter says she is fine but needs help getting up having fallen to the floor. Then six hours into the shift, reports come in of a major traffic accident in central Birmingham requiring multiple paramedic and trauma crews working alongside police and fire services to treat the worst crash they have seen in 20 years(n)

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: 06/06/2018 The latest national and international stories as they break(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: 07/06/2018 Jon Kay and Steph McGovern present national and international news, plus entertainment stories and weather bulletins(n)

programme.title: Britain's Secret Charity Cheats
programme.desc: An insider fraud that threatened a charity benefiting disabled children and a con that led to the demise of a lifeboat charity. Presented by Kevin Duala(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Dion Dublin and Martel Maxwell explore a former chip shop in Cumbria, a one-bedroom flat in London and a plot of land in Greater Manchester(n)

programme.title: Crimewatch Roadshow
programme.desc: Crimewatch Roadshow Live The work of the Metropolitan Police's moped crime unit and how they are tackling crime on two wheels. Plus, advice for football fans on avoiding World Cup ticket fraud(n)

programme.title: Close Calls: On Camera
programme.desc: A young boy falls from a clifftop on to a concrete sea defence, and two British adventurers find themselves trapped in the ice off Alaska as they cross the Bering Sea(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Brampton 13 Two married couples take up the challenge in Brampton, Cumbria, as they battle to find three items to make a profit at auction, with help from experts Anita Manning and David Harper. Tim Wonnacott hosts(n)

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: The Upper Hand Daniel and Zara continue to bicker, while Al, Jimmi and Penny seem to be having far too much fun at work. A patient with a cut finger leaves Karen suspicious(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: North Yorkshire Margherita Taylor helps a woman in North Yorkshire to find a country property, and hits the production line at an organic farm specialising in seasonal veg and fruit boxes(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Compilation - Knighthayes 39 Revisiting some of the locations from the series, including Greenwich Royal Naval College, Althorp House in Northamptonshire, and Herstmonceux Castle, East Sussex(n)

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Liphook Charlie, David and Harry face a challenge in Liphook, Hampshire, where a couple have a big garden and a daughter with her own ideas on what makes the perfect outdoor space(n)

programme.title: Hardball
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Ore Oduba in which contestants have to answer questions to get as far along a track as they can before a ball catches and passes them, ending their go(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants have to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: 07/06/2018 Matt Baker and Alex Jones present the live magazine show featuring a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Jack accuses Keegan of stealing the money from the club and demands to know the names of the other people whose fingerprints were on the bottle. Kim goes to see Phil, convinced he knows Vincent's whereabouts after giving her a shoulder to cry on. Kush grows increasingly concerned about Carmel and pleads with her to talk to a counsellor. Ted gets more than he bargained for on a visit to the allotments(n)

programme.title: Britain's Best Home Cook
programme.desc: Claudia Winkleman presents the quarter-final of the culinary contest. For their first challenge, the home cooks have two-and-a-half hours to prepare a sharing feast with at least four dishes - and as ever the key is to ensure they bring their individual personalities to the table. The judges' favourites get to choose the key ingredients for the second task, coming up with squid and mackerel, and with a semi-final place at stake, the hopefuls put everything into their dishes. Those who do not cut the mustard face the cook-off, which this week requires them to follow a classic chicken recipe(n)

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: DIY SOS: The Big Build: Monmouth Nick Knowles, his team and a group of volunteers are in Monmouth, Wales, to transform the family home of Charlotte, a mother recovering from a stroke that left her with brain damage, speech loss and partial paralysis. The current layout of her home makes it difficult for Charlotte to move around and have her physiotherapy treatment, so the team redesign the house to make things easier for her, her husband Rob and their children(n)

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: 07/06/2018 David Dimbleby chairs the debate from Reading, with a panel of politicians and other guests facing topical questions from the audience(n)

programme.title: This Week
programme.desc: 07/06/2018 Andrew Neil introduces a round-table chat, in which he, Michael Portillo and other guests take a look back at the past seven days' political and parliamentary developments(n)

programme.title: Britain's Secret Charity Cheats
programme.desc: Kevin Duala highlights the case of a bogus children's charity based in Sheffield that led to an international manhunt. Plus, the story of a £5million charity fraud(n)

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Leicester Charlie Dimmock and Dave and Harry Rich head to Leicester, to meet Paul, a personal trainer who would like to use his space for clients, as well as relaxing with friends and family(n)

programme.title: See Hear
programme.desc: Deaf Boxer & BSL Theatre The UK's only professional deaf boxer steps into the ring for his first fight and a group of students are set to graduate from the UK's first degree course for deaf actors(n)

programme.title: Britain in Bloom
programme.desc: Croston Chris Bavin meets the local Bloom group in Croston, Lancashire, who are determined to win a gold award despite coping with the aftermath of a devastating flood(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: 06/06/2018 Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsroom Live
programme.desc: 06/06/2018 A chance to stay up to date on the day's leading stories, with the latest breaking news as it happens(n)

programme.title: Daily Politics
programme.desc: 06/06/2018 Andrew Neil introduces coverage of Prime Minister's Questions from the House of Commons at 12.00, interspersed with discussions, interviews and reports from around the country(n)

programme.title: Perfection
programme.desc: Nick Knowles hosts the general knowledge quiz in which contestants can win a rolling jackpot that starts at £1,000, but only by achieving perfection. If they fail in their attempt, the money is carried over to create a bigger cash prize in the following game(n)

programme.title: Ray Mears' Bushcraft
programme.desc: Jungle Camp Ray sets up camp in the Amazon jungle close to a native village, where he encounters poison dart frogs and climbs into the tree canopy to gain a unique perspective on the surroundings. He also offers an insight into the people who inhabit the dense tropical environment(n)

programme.title: Edwardian Farm
programme.desc: To mark the half-way point of their sociological experiment, Alex Langlands, Peter Ginn and Ruth Goodman explore a single day in an Edwardian farmer's household. Using a cache of letters from the time found in Morwhellham to research the realities of life, the trio experience typical daily routines, from the usual early morning hair-styling and oral hygiene, to the end-of-the-day trip to the local pub(n)

programme.title: Put Your Money Where Your Mouth Is
programme.desc: James Braxton and Danny Sebastian have an altercation at an auction when the two antiques experts end up battling over the same lot(n)

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: The rival antique experts Phil Serrell and Arusha Irvine head to an auction in Greenwich, with Phil buying a satirical poster and Roo picking up a pieces of her favourite glassware(n)

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Ellie Taylor, Steve Pemberton, Fern Britton and Josh Widdicombe test their general knowledge skills in a variety of entertaining trivia-based games(n)

programme.title: Curious Creatures
programme.desc: Niall Strawson and Steve Leonard join team captains Chris Packham and Lucy Cooke on the panel show that tests wildlife knowledge, with Kate Humble asking the questions(n)

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Berkeley to Santa Cruz Michael Portillo visits Yosemite National Park in California, beholding its towering granite cliffs, giant sequoia trees and cascading waterfalls. He then heads to the University of California's seismology department to hear about the devastating 1906 San Francisco earthquake, which claimed the lives of approximately 3,000 people and destroyed more than 80 per cent of the city(n)

programme.title: Love in the Countryside
programme.desc: Farm contractor Buzz juggles dating two best friends who he chose from the speed dating session, while 55-year-old farrier Mark keeps his options open as he dates Renita and Sarah, but there is a twist in the tale for him. Pig farmer Wendy is bonding with Paul, who wants to introduce her to some of his friends from his days as a banker, and the couple sit down to discuss whether love could be on the horizon. Last in the series(n)

programme.title: Detectorists
programme.desc: Andy and Lance have one last day on the farm to pull out all the stops and find the gold. Plus, Terry's got a new gazebo, the perfect time for a rally. Last in the series(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: 06/06/2018 Analysis of the day's events, presented by Emily Maitlis(n)

programme.title: Frankie Goes to Russia
programme.desc: Part one of two. Frankie Boyle explores Russia in advance of the World Cup, looking at what lies behind national stereotypes and exploring the country's football culture. In the first episode, he visits the seaside town hosting the England team and a city renowned for football-related violence. He also joins a daredevil motorbike football team, records a world cup rap, and meets the sabre-wielding Cossacks policing the World Cup stadiums(n)

programme.title: See Hear
programme.desc: Deaf Boxer & BSL Theatre The UK's only professional deaf boxer steps into the ring for his first fight and a group of students are set to graduate from the UK's first degree course for deaf actors(n)

programme.title: The Doctor Who Gave Up Drugs
programme.desc: Part one of two. Dr Chris van Tulleken sets out to understand why so many British children are taking prescription drugs, and looks at possible alternatives to their medication. Chris investigates the alarming rise in prescription medication for ADHD, which has increased 800 per cent since 2000, and also examines the unnecessary use of paracetamol(n)

programme.title: The World's Most Extraordinary Homes
programme.desc: India Architect Piers Taylor and property enthusiast Caroline Quentin explore unique homes in India, including a house built in the highlands outside of Mumbai, and another within the mountainous scenery of the Western Ghats. Elsewhere, the pair also visit a riverside bolthole drawing on Indian architectural heritage, before ending with a unusual building named 'Collage House'(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two(n)

programme.title: Flog It! Trade Secrets
programme.desc: Victorian - Part Two The team examines quirky Victorian collectibles, with David Fletcher visiting Bedford to compare everyday life of the era with the design excesses of the upper orders. Adam Partridge demonstrates an eccentric Victorian invention and the programme catches up with one Flog It! visitor to see how he spent the proceeds of his sale(n)

programme.title: Britain's Secret Charity Cheats
programme.desc: Kevin Duala meets the former paratrooper taking on the bogus military charities collecting on our streets and finds out what benefits charity fundraising balls can bring(n)

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Bourne Charlie Dimmock and Harry and David Rich visit a sparse garden in the town of Bourne, Lincolnshire, whose owners Lizzie and Mike want the colours and feel of an island getaway(n)

programme.title: Love in the Countryside
programme.desc: Dairy farmer Ed is still unsure if he has found the one, so he travels to visit 29-year-old Lisa and 25-year-old Rebecca in each of their home towns. Meanwhile, 59-year-old pig farmer Wendy found herself drawn to former banker Paul and business man Simon, and when both men arrive on her farm, the competition heats up with both men vying for her heart. Elsewhere, Farrier Mark finds himself in a complicated situation when he admits that he is attracted to both of the women he invited to spend time with him in rural East Anglia(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: 07/06/2018 Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsroom Live
programme.desc: 07/06/2018 A chance to stay up to date on the day's leading stories, with the latest breaking news as it happens(n)

programme.title: Daily Politics
programme.desc: 07/06/2018 Jo Coburn and her guests discuss the latest parliamentary proceedings and what has been happening in the world of politics(n)

programme.title: Perfection
programme.desc: Nick Knowles hosts the general knowledge quiz in which contestants can win a rolling jackpot that starts at £1,000, but only by achieving perfection. If they fail in their attempt, the money is carried over to create a bigger cash prize in the following game(n)

programme.title: For What It's Worth
programme.desc: Antiques expert Anita Manning joins host Fern Britton as three pairs of contestants answer questions in a bid to amass antiques and collectibles that can later be converted into cash(n)

programme.title: Ray Mears' Bushcraft
programme.desc: Jungle Trek Ray treks along a traditional Amazon jungle trading path, which runs in the shadow of incredible mountains called Tepui. En route, he finds spectacular waterfalls, clouds of butterflies and one of the most beautiful villages on Earth(n)

programme.title: Edwardian Farm
programme.desc: Spring sees the daffodil harvest, accompanied by a rush to get the flowers off to the train station so they can be delivered to towns and cities across the country within hours of being picked. Alex Langlands and Peter Ginn go to Dartmoor for the annual pony trek, and use the occasion to purchase one of the beasts for the farm. However, before their new pony is fit for work, he needs to be trained, and the farmers hire American horse whisperer Mike Branch for the job. Meanwhile, the arrival of new lambs is followed by a pleasant surprise for Ruth Goodman in the run-up to Mother's Day(n)

programme.title: Put Your Money Where Your Mouth Is
programme.desc: Auctioneer James Braxton and dealer Danny Sebastian go bargain-hunting at a car-boot sale in West Sussex, where items that catch their eyes include a set of scales and a barrel(n)

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Arusha Irvine and Philip Serrell explore Oxfordshire for antiques, taking them to auction in Stratford-upon-Avon. They also learn about the queen of 19th-century science(n)

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Comedians Ellie Taylor and Josh Widdicombe, actor and writer Steve Pemberton and presenter Fern Britton continue the daily test of their skills. Hosted by Richard Osman(n)

programme.title: Curious Creatures
programme.desc: Team captains Chris Packham and Lucy Cooke are joined by Christy Harrison and Vim Kumaratunga for another test of wildlife knowledge, hosted by Kate Humble(n)

programme.title: RHS Chatsworth Flower Show
programme.desc: Adam Frost, Carol Klein, Arit Anderson, Nick Bailey and Mark Lane present highlights from this year's RHS flower show at Chatsworth. They seek out horticultural inspiration and planting design ideas in the show gardens and floral marquee, discover why conifers could be coming back into fashion and explore Chatsworth's rich orchid history(n)

programme.title: Springwatch
programme.desc: Springwatch 2018 Chris Packham and Michaela Strachan are joined by guests Iolo Williams and Lucy Cooke at the National Trust's Sherborne Park in Gloucestershire to look back at another busy few days. Gillian Burke reports on a piece of massive mining machinery that was once the largest machine in the world, but since being mothballed has been colonised by all kinds of birds(n)

programme.title: Million Pound Menu
programme.desc: Trap Kitchen and Greedy Khao Fred Sirieix meets the teams behind two more food concepts seeking money to start up their own restaurants. Trap Kitchen is a soul food-inspired takeaway from south London selling lobster tails, waffles, mac 'n' cheese and prawns in food boxes prepared in owner Prince's own sound London home, while Greedy Khao is a vegan Thai grab-and-go concept established by husband and wife Lee and Faai. Will the investors like what they see?(n)

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: New series. Dara O Briain returns with a new run of the topical comedy show. Regular panellist Hugh Dennis looks back on another eventful week in news and politics, with the help of fellow comedians James Acaster, Angela Barnes, Ed Gamble, Darren Harriott and Zoe Lyons. Yet again, stand-up and improvisation are the name of the game as the contestants try to get one up on each other(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: 07/06/2018 Analysis of the day's events, presented by Evan Davis(n)

programme.title: The Secrets of Your Food
programme.desc: Season 1 Episode 1/3(n)
programme.episode-num: Season 1 Episode 1/3|Michael Mosley and James Wong reveal the physics, chemistry and biology hidden inside various foods. In the opening episode they explore how this chemistry fuels and builds bodies, with Michael sampling most people's first meal - human breast milk, which contains important fats, carbohydrates, vitamins and minerals. Michael and James also unravel why sourdough bread is so beneficial, how the rice has become a comforting staple food, and why allowing mushrooms to `sunbathe' may help provide a welcome calcium boost <div class="other"> (Subtitles) (Repeat) (Audio Described)
